item.title: CRUD APIs are Poor Design
item.description: I’m convinced that CRUD APIs and CRUD-driven systems—meaning systems built around Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations—are, in the long run, the hardest to change and evolve. This might sound unintuitive at first, especially since many of us have read blog posts, watched videos, or taken courses on building HTTP APIs under the guise of… Read More »CRUD APIs are Poor Design The post CRUD APIs are Poor Design appeared first on CodeOpinion.
